articleParts.text: Ship entities in Starsector are comprised of several parts: sprite, hull file, and CSV data row. On top of that, skin file can act as a mutator of hull file (in other words, skin file applies changes to base hull to result in a modified hull file that is considered to be a skin), and variant file is a layer on top of the hull, containing all the info about installed weapons and hullmods.
To get started with hull creation and saving, follow these steps:

1. Create new ship layer. Then open a sprite file to this layer. Note that the opened sprite loads to the layer that is currently selected - something to be aware of if you have several layers in work.

2. Once you have a layer with a graphical data - which is your sprite file - you can either open existing hull file onto it or create a brand new hull data. Navigate to the Layer menu and choose 'Create new ship data'.
3. Now you can descend through editor tabs and populate the hull with needed data. Start with collision and ship center, then shield center and radius, then bounds, and so on.
Once you have finished editing hull data, right-click the layer tab and choose 'Save hull data'.
Note that the resulting .ship file still requires CSV data to be available - consider using specialized CSV editor for that.
